title.narrative: Maintaing and advocating for Freedom of Religion or Belief in Indonesia

description.narrative: The project strives to increase the respect, protection and promotion of freedom of religion of belief and to strengthen access to justice for victims of FoRB by empowering civil society actors and human rights defenders, nationally and in four cities.

title.narrative: Output 1.3 Production of textbooks, online free learnings material and a manual on FoRB advocacy in societies

People will understand more about the realm of FoRB in Indonesia and become encouraged to fight for FoRB in their society. The discourse on FoRB will be more popular and/or discussed by educational institution, CSO, and government. 4.000 printed books (reflection: 2.000 books, manual: 2.000 books); thousands of people will read these books and and become aware of their right to FoRB.

target.value: Focus group discussions and meetings with 30 experts and writers, field research, writing process managed by CCI.
Production of manual book and online learning material of FoRB advocacy and its launching/workshops in 3 hotspots of violation of FoRB in 3 regions and Jakarta.

Production of reflection book and online learning material on FoRB and its launching/seminars in 4 targeted sites and Jakarta. Final report with policy recommendations to the government (local and national).

title.narrative: Output 1. Societies in the four cities of interventions have access to legal aid service from qualified FoRB defenders and/or organizations who serve society for legal aid, including CCI; cases of violations of FoRB in societies will be used by CCI and its collaborated organisations as advocacy responses to the cases of FoRB violations.

Qualitative: Stories of successful cases of Indonesian people, especially the minor and discriminated communities in the targeted sites, practicing their religious or belief teachings without being abused. Quantitative: List of qualified FoRB defenders and/or organizations who have commitment to serve legal aid for people in the targeted sites

target.value: Through the trainings in 2 targeted sites for the local FoRB defenders, especially from legal aid organizations, there will be qualified people/organizations who improve their ability to provide legal aid to people experiencing FoRB-violations.

Through the trainings in 2 targeted sites for the local FoRB defenders, especially from legal aid organizations, there will be qualified people/organizations who commit to improve their advocacy for the violated people or minorities.
Monitoring and evaluation on FoRB situation and its advocacy in the targeted sites. 50% of the people experiencing FoRB violations in the four targeted sites will have access to legal aid.

title.narrative: Outcome 1. FoRB defenders and civil society actors (youth and religious/social leaders) act as agents of changes of FoRB through capacity development, empowerment and advocacy

Societies where the FoRB defenders and civil society actors come from will experience more events or supports to build and maintain FoRB in their societies/communities. They will engage in activities addressing policies/regulations. At least 4.000 people will receive the benefits or impacts of the trainings through the 200 participants (each of them will be responsible to train/educate 20 people as follow up of the trainings).

target.value: The targeted sites will have many agents of changes who are reliable and qualified to promote FoRB and advocate any cases.

title.narrative: Outcome 2. Strengthened access to justice for victims of FoRB violations in the four areas in Indonesia. Qualified legal aid to be able to claim rights.
Successful cases of legal aid provision for victims of FoRB violations documented

target.value: Vulnerable or minor communities will have more access to bring their issues and get the advocacies, especially in the 4 targeted sites.
